definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people responsible for the submitted dataset
value: Zachary Gold | Sean McAllister | Brynn Zalmanek

definition: A list (concatenated and separated) of the globally unique identifier for the people responsible for the submitted dataset
A contact person and their contact (i.e., email address) for data enquiry
An institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.
An identifier for the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.
Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized
A brief, concise project identifier with no spaces or special characters, ensuring machine readability. This ID will be used in data file names as 'project_id'.
An identifier or name of the overarching (parent) project that encompasses and organizes multiple related sub-projects, each identified by a unique project_id
The variable(s) examined in the study, including those of direct interests to address study aims and covariates.
example: benthic habitat types | diurnal time series | filter types
value: pelagic & benthic habitat types | biogeographic time series | phytoplankton | microbiome | zooplankton | benthic invertebrates | fishes | marine mammals

definition: The method used in the eDNA study to detect taxon/taxa of interest in environmental sample. A targeted eDNA assay is designed to detect the presence of a specific species or a small subset of taxa (such as a genus or family) using techniques like quantitative PCR (qPCR). This contrasts with a metabarcoding eDNA assay which aims to characterize the composition of broader taxonomic communities, often encompassing multiple phyletic groups, by utilising high-throughput sequencing such as metabarcoding
the protocols to minimise contaminations in the field and/or laboratory
example: Sampling bottles were rinsed with 10% bleached and DI water. Single-use syringes and capsule filters were used for filtration. Single-use gloves were used to collect and filter each sample.

definition: Were negative controls applied during the project? Yes = 1, No = 0. For further details, record the types of negative controls under the term neg_cont_type in projectMetadata
Were positive controls applied during the project? Yes = 1, No = 0. For further details, record the types of positive controls under the term pos_cont_type in projectMetadata
The version number of the FAIR eDNA (FAIRe) metadata checklist used to format the data
The last date on which the database information was modified, following the ISO 8601 format of yyyy-mm-dd
A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource.
A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.
example: The Regents of the University of California
value: USA Department of Commerce National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration

definition: Information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status.
Additional information that exists, but that has not been shared in the given record.
example: location information not given for endangered species

definition: Actions taken to make the shared data (i.e. location, date) less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request. Note this is not related to genetic generalisation within bioinforamtics workflows (i.e., OTU clustering).
example: Coordinates generalized from original GPS coordinates to the nearest half degree grid cell.

definition: A bibliographic reference for the resource.
A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence. i.e., links to a project website, submitted raw sequence data and environmental metadata.
Link to public repository where analysis code is archived
The numbe of biological replicated collected at each sampling point and/or for each experimental treatment in the study.
identifier for the cruise expedition with year in parantheses.
